de.ovgu.featureide.fm.core.base

Interface IPropertyContainer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MapPropertyContainer, UnmodifiablePropertyContainer

    public interface IPropertyContainer
    Classes implementing IPropertyContainer act as objects that can be enriched with arbitrary user-defined values by key-value mappings ("properties").
    Since:
    3.0
    Author:
    Marcus Pinencke

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  IPropertyContainer.Entry<K,T,V> 
      static class  IPropertyContainer.NoSuchPropertyException
      Thrown by IPropertyContainer implementations indicating a request for a unknown property, e.g., by reading from an unknown key
      static class  IPropertyContainer.Type

    • Method Detail

      • get

        <T> T get(java.lang.String key,
          T defaultValue)
        Reads a per-object user-defined property identified by a custom key, and returns the stored value if a value was assigned by calling set(String, Type, Object) earlier. Properties are stored persistently if ValueProtection.NORMAL_PROTECTION or ValueProtection.READ_ONLY_PERSISTENT was used when calling set(String, Type, Object) or temporarily. The latest (maybe volatile) state will be taken into account, depending on the call of remove(String). If no value was assigned (the key is unknown), the defaultValue will be returned.
        Parameters:
        key - property name (case insensitive)
        defaultValue - value to return if no property is set
        Returns:
        value associated with key if set, defaultValue otherwise
        Since:
        3.0
        See Also:
        get(String, Object), has(String), remove(String)

      • getDataType

        IPropertyContainer.Type getDataType(java.lang.String key)
                             throws IPropertyContainer.NoSuchPropertyException
        Throws:
        IPropertyContainer.NoSuchPropertyException

      • get

        <T> T get(java.lang.String key)
   throws IPropertyContainer.NoSuchPropertyException
        Reads a per-object user-defined property identified by a custom key, and returns the stored value if a value was assigned by calling set(String, Type, Object) earlier. Properties are stored persistently such that an assignment will be alive as long as it was not removed by calling remove(String). If no value was assigned (the key is unknown), a NoSuchPropertyException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        key - property name (case insensitive)
        Returns:
        value associated with key if set. If key is not known, throws NoSuchPropertyException.
        Throws:
        IPropertyContainer.NoSuchPropertyException
        Since:
        3.0
        See Also:
        get(String, Object), has(String), remove(String)

      • has

        boolean has(java.lang.String key)
        Checks if this object contains a property associated with the given key. Returns true if at some point earlier set(String, Type, Object) was called with the corresponding key. Properties are stored persistently such that an assignment will be alive as long as it was not removed by calling remove(String), and, hence, key will be alive. If no property is associated to key the method will return false.
        Parameters:
        key - property name (case insensitive)
        Returns:
        true if the object contains a property associated to key, false otherwise.
        Since:
        3.0

      • keySet

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> keySet()
        Returns a distinct collection of each assigned key for this object in (possible empty) set. Since keys are case-insensitive it depends on the implementation if the user-defined strings once passed as keys are changed in some way, e.g., by converting to lower case strings.
        Returns:
        all keys of properties assigned to this object

      • entrySet

        java.util.Set<IPropertyContainer.Entry<java.lang.String,IPropertyContainer.Type,java.lang.Object>> entrySet()

      • setEntrySet

        void setEntrySet(java.util.Set<IPropertyContainer.Entry<java.lang.String,IPropertyContainer.Type,java.lang.Object>> entries)
        Removes the content of this container and stores the entries entries into this one. The entries are copied, such that entries != this.getPropertyEntries() afterwards, which also holds for any entry inside entries.
        Parameters:
        entries - Entries to import

      • remove

        void remove(java.lang.String key)
     throws IPropertyContainer.NoSuchPropertyException
        Removes a per-object user-defined property identified by a custom key and value assigned by calling set(String, Type, Object) earlier. Properties are stored persistently such that an assignment will be alive as long as it this method does not remove the property. If this object does not contain any property associated to key, a NoSuchPropertyException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        key - property name (case insensitive)
        Throws:
        IPropertyContainer.NoSuchPropertyException
        Since:
        3.0
        See Also:
        has(String), set(String, Type, Object)

      • set

        <T> void set(java.lang.String key,
             IPropertyContainer.Type type,
             T value)
        Sets a per-object user-defined property consisting of a values associated with a user-defined key. If key is already set, the behavior of this method depends on the KeyConflictPolicy.

        Properties are stored persistently such that an assignment will be alive as long as it was not removed by calling remove(String).

        To receive the value behind a key, call get(String, Object).
        Parameters:
        key - property name (case insensitive)
        type - type of value to be stored
        value - value to be stored
        Since:
        3.0
